setspec.clusters:
Which component(s) of the circulatory system acts as a pump? the heart the valves the lungs the blood vessels Why doesn't oxygen rich blood flow directly from the lungs to the rest of the body? because blood needs a pump to circulate it because blood must go back to the heart so the heart can receive blood also because valves stop the bloodflow because the blood needs to have the oxygen removed first (before it goes to the rest of the body) cloze Which component(s) of the circulatory system acts as a pump? (?=.*heart).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is the heart. cloze Why doesn't oxygen rich blood flow directly from the lungs to the rest of the body? (?=.*pump).*$|((?=.*mov)|(?=.*circul)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is because blood needs a pump to circulate it. Which type of blood vessel does blood flow through first when leaving the heart? arteries veins alveoli capillaries Why do the arteries have thicker walls than other blood vessels? because arteries must withstand the high pressure of the blood coming directly from the pump/heart because arteries carry blood with a very high concentration of oxygen because arteries have muscles in their walls to pump blood because arteries must contain (and control) more blood than other blood vessels cloze Which type of blood vessel does blood flow through first when leaving the heart? (?=.*arter).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is arteries. cloze Why do the arteries have thicker walls than other blood vessels? (?=.*pressure).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is because arteries must withstand the high pressure of blood coming directly from the heart/pump. Which type of blood vessel carries blood toward the heart? veins capillaries arteries atrium What type of blood vessel would carry blood with the highest concentration of carbon dioxide? veins arteries capillaries lungs cloze Which type of blood vessel carries blood toward the heart? (?=.*vein).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is veins. cloze What type of blood vessel would carry blood with the highest concentration of carbon dioxide? (?=.*vein).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is veins. What is the size difference between vessels close to the heart and those further away? blood vessels closer to the heart are larger than those further away blood vessels further away are bigger than those closer to the heart blood vessels further away are double the size of those closer to the heart there is no size difference Where are the largest veins in the body located? near the heart in the neck in the extremeties near the groin cloze What is the size difference between vessels close to the heart and those further away? (?=.*small)((?=.*fur)|(?=.*far)|(?=.*away)).*$|((?=.*large)|(?=.*big))((?=.*close)|(?=.*near)|(?=.*around)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is blood vessels closer to the heart are larger than those further away. cloze Where are the largest veins in the body located? (?=.*heart).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is near the heart. What are the top and bottom chambers of the heart called? Answer in that order. atria and ventricles right and left atria atria and alveoli alveoli and ventricles How many discharging chamber(s) are there in the heart and how many discharging chamber(s) are there per circle of the circulatory system? Answer in that order. two discharging chambers total, one per circle four discharging chambers total, two per circle four discharging chambers total, one per circle two discharging chambers total, two per circle cloze What are the top and bottom chambers of the heart called? Answer in that order. (atri)(.*ventric).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is atria and ventricles. cloze How many discharging chamber(s) are there in the heart and how many discharging chamber(s) are there per circle of the circulatory system? Answer in that order. ((two)|(2))((.*one)|(.*1)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is two discharging chambers total, and one per circle. Which of the septums in the heart is/are solid and which has/have openings? Answer in that order. the vertical septum is solid and the horizontal septum has openings ventricles are solid and atria have openings all of the septums in the heart have openings all of the septums in the heart are solid A defect called "hole in the heart" causes a hole to form in one of the septums of the heart. Which septum would this abnormality refer to? vertical septum hoirzonal septum left septum right septum cloze Which of the septums in the heart is/are solid and which has/have openings? Answer in that order. ((.*vertic)|(.*ventricular)(.*atrial))(.*horizontal).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is the vertical septum is solid and the horizontal septum has openings. cloze A defect called "hole in the heart" causes a hole to form in one of the septums of the heart. Which septum would this abnormality refer to? ((?=.*vertic)|(?=.*ventric)|(?=.*atrial)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is vertical septum. " How many circles are there in the circulatory system? 2 3 1 4 What does it mean that the heart is a ""double-pump""? it pumps blood out for both circles (out of the left side and out of the right side). It pumps twice as much blood It pumps blood into the heart and out of the heart It pumps oxygen to parts of the body and also pumps blood to other parts cloze How many circles are there in the circulatory system? ((?=.*two)|(?=.*2)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is 2. cloze What does it mean that the heart is a ""double-pump""? ((?=.*oxy)(?=.*carbon dio)).*$|((?=.*circle)|(?=.*cycle))|((?=.*left)(?=.*right)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is it pumps blood out for both circles (out of the left side and out of the right side). " The ____ side of the heart receives blood from the veins and pumps it to ____. right, the lungs left, the body left, the lungs right, the left side Blood with a high concentration of oxygen is sometimes referred to as "fresh blood." Which chamber(s) of the heart would contain fresh blood? the left atrium and left ventricle the right atrium and right ventricle the atria the ventricles cloze The ____ side of the heart receives blood from the veins and pumps it to ____. (right)((.*lung)|(.*pulmon)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is right, the lungs. cloze Blood with a high concentration of oxygen is sometimes referred to as "fresh blood." Which chamber(s) of the heart would contain fresh blood? (?=.*right).*$~Incorrect. The correct answer is the left atrium and left ventricle.;(?=.*left)(?=.*atri)(?=.*ventric).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is the left atrium and left ventricle. The ___ side of the heart receives blood from the lungs and pumps it to _____. left, the body right, the lungs left, the right side left, the ventricles Blood with a high concentration of carbon dioxide is a dark red color. Which chamber(s) of the heart would contain dark red blood? the right atrium and right ventricle the left atrium and left ventricle the atria the ventricles cloze The ___ side of the heart receives blood from the lungs and pumps it to _____. (left)((.*body)|(.*systemic)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is left, the body. cloze Blood with a high concentration of carbon dioxide is a dark red color. Which chamber(s) of the heart would contain dark red blood? (?=.*right)(?=.*atri)(?=.*ventric).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is the right atrium and right ventricle. In the heart, what physically separates the two circles of the circulatory system? vertical septum chest valves horizontal septum Why is it important for the two circles of the circulatory system physically separated from each other? so that the oxygen-rich blood and carbon dioxide-rich blood do not mix so the circles don't get to bunched up together so that the correct amount of blood is pumped so that the circles are kept separated to the right and left side of the body cloze In the heart, what physically separates the two circles of the circulatory system? ((?=.*vertical)|(?=.*atrial)|(?=.*ventricular))((?=.*sept)|(?=.*wall)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is vertical septum. cloze Why is it important for the two circles of the circulatory system physically separated from each other? ((?=.*mix)|(?=.*combin)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is so that the oxygen-rich blood and carbon dioxide-rich blood do not mix. Blood is sent to various parts of the body from which specific chamber of the heart? left ventricle left atrium right atrium right ventricle Which specific chamber(s) of the heart would need the thickest (strongest) walls and why? the left ventricle because it propels blood to the rest of the body the right atrium because they receives large amounts of blood the left and right ventricles because they are closer to the chest and need more protection The left atrium and left ventricle because they have oxygen-rich blood. cloze Blood is sent to various parts of the body from which specific chamber of the heart? (?=.*left)(?=.*ventric).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is left ventricle. cloze Which specific chamber(s) of the heart would need the thickest (strongest) walls and why? (?=.*left )(?=.*ventric)((?=.*propel)|(?=.*pump))((?=.*body)|(?=.*systemic)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is the left ventricle because it must propel blood to the rest of the body. In terms of interacting with the cells of the body, blood serves what two functions? Blood delivers oxygen and removes carbon dioxide Blood offers protection from infection and temperature regulation Blood is responsible for communication and transportation Blood moves cells and keeps the heart pumping Some aquatic species do not have circulatory systems because the water around them essentially serves the same function as the human circulatory system. What function would the water around them serve? provides nutrients and eliminates toxins through gas exchange provides temperature control provides pressure to keep the blood vessels in place provides a pump through wave motion cloze In terms of interacting with the cells of the body, blood serves what two functions? (?=((.*tak)|(.*rid)|(.*remov)).*(carbon diox))(?=((.*bring)|(.*deliver)|(.*giv)|(.*suppl)).*(oxy))|(?=.*gas)(?=.*exchang).*~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is blood delivers oxygen and removes carbon dioxide. cloze Some aquatic species do not have circulatory systems because the water around them essentially serves the same function as the human circulatory system. What function would the water around them serve? (?=((.*tak)|(.*rid)|(.*remov)).*(carbon diox))(?=((.*bring)|(.*deliver)|(.*giv)|(.*suppl)).*(oxy))|(?=.*gas)(?=.*exchang).*~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is provides nutrients and eliminates toxins through gas exchange. Which blood vessel allows oxygen and carbon dioxide to pass in and out? capillaries alveoli arteries veins Why are the walls of capillaries much thinner than the other blood vessels? to allow for gas exchange because capillaries carry less blood so that the blood can flow through them more quickly because capillaries must reach tiny parts of the body cloze Which blood vessel allows oxygen and carbon dioxide to pass in and out? (?=.*capil).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is capillaries. cloze Why are the walls of capillaries much thinner than the other blood vessels? (?=.*gas)(?=.*exchang).*$|(?=.*oxy)(?=.*carbon dio).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is to allow for gas e xchange. What is the first part of the heartbeat? the heart muscles contracting the heart muscles expanding the walls of the heart bumping against the rib cage the heart valves opening What effect would stronger heart muscle have on a person's heart rate and why? it would lower the heart rate because the heart can pump more blood with each contraction it would increase the heart rate because the heart is strong enough to pump blood at a faster rate it would lower the heart rate because it takes more effort to contract the large muscles it would increase the heart rate because the rest of the body would likely also be strong, and need more blood/oxygen cloze What is the first part of the heartbeat? ((?=.*contract)|(?=.*squeez)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is the heart muscles contracting. cloze What effect would stronger heart muscle have on a person's heart rate and why? (?=.*more)((?=.*low)|(?=.*decrease))((?=.*pump)|(?=.*beat)|(?=.*contract)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is it would lower the heart rate because the heart can pump more blood with each contraction. Which part of the heart contracts first in each heartbeat? atria the right side ventricles left atrium If the left atrium is contracting now, when does the right atrium contract? the right atrium would contract at the same time as the left atrium the right atrium would contract before the left atrium the right atrium would contract after the left atrium the right atrium does not contract cloze Which part of the heart contracts first in each heartbeat? (?=.*atri).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is atria. cloze If the left atrium is contracting now, when does the right atrium contract? ((?=.*now)|(?=.*same)|(?=.*during)).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is at the same time. What prevents blood from flowing backward in the heart? valves pressure veins air Blood in the legs that is flowing back to the heart is moving against gravity (i.e., it's trying to flow up). The pressure of the heart pumping prevents the blood from flowing downward, but what other component of the circulatory system could work here to prevent the blood from flowing downward/ backward? valves muscles cholesterol capillaries cloze What prevents blood from flowing backward in the heart? (?=.*valve).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is valves. cloze Blood in the legs that is flowing back to the heart is moving against gravity (i.e., it's trying to flow up). The pressure of the heart pumping prevents the blood from flowing downward, but what other component of the circulatory system could work here to prevent the blood from flowing downward/ backward? (?=.*valve).*$~Correct;.*~Incorrect. The correct answer is valves. Age? 18-25 26-34 35-54 55-64 65 and over Gender? Less than High School High School or GED Some College 4-year College Degree/ Bachelors Graduate Degree Do you now, or have you ever, worked in a profession that dealt with knowledge of the circulatory system?

For example, if you have ever worked in any of the following jobs, you should select "Yes": nurse, EMT, student majoring in biology, teaching 12th grade anatomy, etc.
